transcript: - [Riley] Oh man! Did you hear about that some tech news that already happened? We've gotten our first review of an Intel discrete graphics card - [James] Woop woop! - [Riley] thanks to YouTuber 'ETA Prime' getting his hands on a prebuilt system from Cyber Power with the Intel GG... DGG1, bro. GG. Yeah, we had seen reviews of the SDV version of the card, but that was only distributed to software developers, while this is the consumer model and, unsurprisingly, the DG1 is not a great gaming card. It's only about 30% faster that Intel CPUs with integrated Z graphics. But the DG1 is great at power efficiency, meaning more powerful variance of Intel's GPUs could be pretty impressive. - [James] Imagine if you could buy it, though? [Chuckles] - [Riley] That's the... That's the... - [James] That's all I need! - [Riley] That's the most mind blowing possibility. - [James] ...all I need to do. - [Riley] Indeed a leak from a somewhat reliable tipster "Tum Apasak" on Twitter indicates that Intel's higher power DG2 could compete with an RX 6700 XT and an RTX 3070! Intel has said that they are down to use AMD's FidelityFX super resolution feature, so maybe, that could boost performance even more in the... seven mid tier games it is rumored to support at launch. Look I'm trying to find any piece of GPU, hope I can in these times, okay? I believe we will return to that time when every infant sleeps with their very own GPU in the crib. - [James] Don't need a blanket. - [Riley] It's pokey! Builds character. Speaking of GPUs, NVIDIA apparently launched the RTX 3070 Ti last week, but no one seems to have seen it anywhere. At first, it seemed like on launch day, stocks sold out quickly, everywhere, as expected. Darn bots and scalpers probably got everything before anyone had a chance, but many bots and scalpers say they weren't even able to get cards. An operator of one prominent service called, "FixItFixItFixIt" that checks stock every 10 seconds claims the card never even showed up as available to buy. NVIDIA hasn't commented on what the heck happened but the evidence is certainly making it look like this was a "paper launch", and every GPU launch is basically a paper launch already. Now you know what I'd like is a paper lunch... bag, I'm quite hungry. Jamie, do you have any food? In your pockets? And TeamGroup has waited long enough and will finally be launching some of the first consumer grade DDR5 desktop memory modules later this month. With availability at major retailers like, Amazon and Newegg. You can grab 32 GB worth of, of the future for only $399! Oh! It's probably worth it. - [James] TeamGroup! [Chuckles] - [Riley] Now you might say, "that's weird" consumers don't have anything to plug those puppies into right now, because the first consumer motherboards to support DDR5 will be until 600 series models, reportedly coming this fall. But those RTX 3070 Ti scalpers didn't get anything so, it's only fair we give them a bit of a head start for at least, you know, keep it. We live in a society. WAIT! If I'm Riley, Who's that? - [James] Team Poop! - [Riley] Team Poop. Now it's time for Quick Bits, brought to you by Story Blocks and their massive library of stock footage, images, audio and After Effects templates. You and me, we're story tellers and, Story Blocks can help us bring our stories to life without sacrificing our time, budget or resources. We need those things! Story Blocks has affordable subscriptions with unlimited video and audio downloads, and they even got an in-browser video editor so, you can make quick changes on the fly. We use it on Tech Linked almost every episode because there's over 1 million different stock assets and, if we had to film a Bitcoin every time we mention cryptocurrency, Elon Musk would tweet again by the time the video goes up and everything would be ruined. Save the planet. Check out Story Blocks today at, storyblocks.com/techlinked I-I'm pretty sure you're gonna wanna see these quick bits. [chuckles] Amazon has followed Apple's and Google's lead and reduced the 30% cut it takes from the Amazon app store. It's a thing. What is it? A Kindles? For developers earning less that $1 million annually, the reduced cut is 20%, while Google's and Apple's is 15% but, developers will also get 10% to use as credit for Amazon Web Services. And I don't know about you, but I always appreciate a gift card instead... - [James] There's nothing like a good Amazon gift card. [Chuckles] - [Riley] Well, no... for cloud services. Canon's Chinese subsidiary has added AI powered cameras, you'll like this James, that will only let workers enter rooms or book meetings if they're smiling. - [James] Ohhh. - [Riley] It's a-It's a great way to ensure your workers are happy. Because if someone is smiling, that means they are happy. WOW! If you're not happy, maybe that's because you haven't gotten the new Tamagotchi smartwatch yet. That's right. For the 25th anniversary of the digital pets, Bandai is making a limited run, wrist mounted version, that you can only buy by entering a lottery between now and July 2nd. I know there's nothing that makes me smile more than checking the time and seeing a massive pixels representing animal poop. It's-It's cuter than the real thing. - [James] Team Poop [chuckles] - [Riley] Wow we're going all over the place here China has successfully launched its first crude mission to the country's Tianhe, I'm saying that wrong, space station. - [James] What was crude about it? [chuckles] - [Riley] They were swearing the whole time. The crew docked hours after the launch and will be spending the next few months preparing for the next 11 launches, that will bring the space station to full functionality in 2022. Geez, China. You're fast. Can the west just have a moment to think about the fact that we won't be number 1 anymore? And Grand Theft Auto online maybe shutting down on PS3 and Xbox 360, but console players could try playing "Gan Theft Auto". A simulation of the game generated entirely by a neural network called, "Game Gan". The simulation doesn't involve and actually game code, it's just generated by the network after it was trained on images of GA... GTA V. So playing it, is kinda like being in like a robot's dream. DANG! That's poetic, dude. Watch out though, it will try to inception you. Oh, no. The dream is collapsing because this episode is over. Come back on Monday for more tech news and we'll go... Even deeper. - [James] But smile, you're not allowed in. - [Riley] Wha? Oh! That was a reference to the
